question.question-text: The word blast in paragraph 1 is closest in meaning to
question.explain-text: The passage mentions a brilliant bluish-white fireball and states that it exploded and that the blast was heard 1,000 kilometers away. From this context, it can be determined that blast is closest in meaning to explosion. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: There was so much haze that it could even be seen by astronomers on the other side of the world.

question.explain-text: The passage mentions a glowing reddish haze. A sentence stating that there was so much haze would logically follow such an idea. The last square in paragraph 1 is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word it in paragraph 2 refers to
question.explain-text: The passage states that when an expedition finally went in search of the site of the blast, it found that the blast had occurred. From this context, it can be determined that it refers to an expedition. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word radially in paragraph 2 is closest in meaning to

answer-list.answer-text: like the rings in a tree

answer-text.exp: like the spokes of a wheel

answer-list.answer-text: like the corners of a square
like the fingers on a hand

question.explain-text: The passage states that the remaining trees had been flattened radially away from the center of the blast. From this context, it can be determined that radially is closest in meaning to like the spokes of a wheel. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 2?

answer-list.answer-text: Because branchless trees were still standing where they were located, investigators determined that the point of impact must be at least a few kilometers away.
Because there was no apparent crater at the center of the blast area, it was concluded that the explosion took place above the surface of the Earth.
Because there was no visible crater, a conclusion was drawn that whatever had exploded had buried itself deep in the ground.
When viewed from above the ground at a distance of several kilometers, the amazing results of the impact could clearly be seen.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that no discernible crater was in evidence, which means that there was no apparent crater at the center of the blast area, and that it was concluded that a huge explosion must have taken place at least a few kilometers above the blast area, which means that it was concluded that the explosion took place above the surface of the Earth. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word it in paragraph 3 refers to
question.explain-text: The passage states that the event at Tunguska was so unusual and mentions hypotheses…to explain it. From this context, it can be determined that it refers to the event. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 3?

answer-list.answer-text: The main hypothesis was that an enemy airforce from another country was attempting to land near a nuclear reactor.
No one believed that an alien spaceship could have been the cause of the huge explosion.
One hypothesis was that the huge explosion resulted from problems with a nuclear reactor.

answer-text.exp: Some people believed that the explosion occurred when a ship from outer space had mechanical problems.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that one hypothesis was that an alien spaceship with a malfunctioning nuclear reactor…exploded, which means that some people believed that the explosion occurred when a ship from outer space had mechanical problems. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word some in paragraph 4 refers to
question.explain-text: The passage mentions what many astronomers now suspect and states that there are some who oppose this view. From this context, it can be determined that some refers to astronomers. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The phrase was heading for in paragraph 4 is closest in meaning to
question.explain-text: The passage states that a comet or comet fragment was heading for the Earth. From this context, it can be determined that the phrase was heading for is closest in meaning to was approaching. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word it in paragraph 4 refers to
question.explain-text: The passage states that a comet or comet fragment was heading for the Earth and that it was coming from the direction of the sun. From this context, it can be determined that it refers to a comet or comet fragment. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 4?

answer-list.answer-text: There are several plausible explanations as to why a tail was not visible behind the comet.
Even though some people were not able to see a tail on the comet, the comet actually had a rather magnificent tail.
The comet had a tail that was only a fragment of the size of a normal tail on a comet.
Because the comet was heading away from Earth, the tail was hidden behind various fragments in the sky.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that a characteristic tail was not seen following the comet, which means that a tail was not visible behind the comet and that this could have been either because…, because…, or because…, which means that there are several plausible explanations. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: The word establishes in paragraph 4 could best be replaced by
question.explain-text: The passage mentions something that further establishes the validity of the hypothesis. From this context, it can be determined that establishes could best be replaced by supports. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: One hypothesis, however, is now more widely accepted.

question.explain-text: The first sentence of the third paragraph states that a number of bizarre hypotheses have been proposed, and the first sentence of the fourth paragraph starts with what many astronomers now suspect. From this, it can be determined that a sentence stating that one hypothesis, however, is now more widely accepted would logically be used to introduce the fourth paragraph and serve as a transition between the ideas in the third and fourth paragraphs. The first square in paragraph 4 is therefore the best answer to this question.
